com.aeonium.javafx.actions

Class FXActionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aeonium.javafx.actions.FXActionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.util.Callback<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.Object>

    public class FXActionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.util.Callback<java.lang.Class<?>,java.lang.Object>

    The FXActionManager is a controller factory as well as an annotation processor. It is used to create the controller for a JavaFX FXML document, and subsequently search the controller instance for runtime annotations that describe the mapping of actions to ui elements. Use in in a way like: 

    
  public void start(Stage stage) throws Exception {
 FXActionManager myActionControllerFactory = new FXActionManager();

 // Shortcut, if you have a fxml without stylesheets
 //Parent root = FXMLLoader.load(
 //        getClass().getResource("FXMLDocument.fxml"),
 //        null,
 //        null, myActionControllerFactory);

 // use this approach if the fxml uses stylesheets:
 FXMLLoader fxmlLoader = new FXMLLoader();
 fxmlLoader.setLocation(getClass().getResource("FXMLDocument.fxml"));
 fxmlLoader.setControllerFactory(myActionControllerFactory);
 Parent root = (Parent) fxmlLoader.load();

 myActionControllerFactory.initActions();

 // optional: get the action by its type and parametrize it:
 MyAction action = myActionControllerFactory.getAction(MyAction.class);
 action.setText("Erste Aktion");

 Scene scene = new Scene(root);

 stage.setScene(scene);
 stage.show();
 }

    As the example shows, the .getAction()-Method is used as a universal factory method for the action instances. You may create actions yourself, but this is not the recommended way.

    Please note: This approach implies that your actions should be thought of as "quasi-singletons", i.e., the FXActionManager only knows one instance of each action class. This is a design constraint that should be taken care of.

    Author:
    robert rohm

      • initActions

        public void initActions()
        Initialize the actions that are annotated in the controllers, i.e., process the annotations of all objects that have been added to the controllers list. Each object is only processed once, so it is safe to invoke this method repeatedly.

      • initActions

        public void initActions(java.lang.Object controller)
        A variant of initActions() for use with already instantiated controllers.
        Parameters:
        controller - The controller to be initialized

      • getAction

        public <T extends FXAbstractAction> T getAction(java.lang.Class<T> c)
                                         throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Factory method for action instances. An action is first looked for in the instances map. If it is not found, it gets created and registered in the map. Hence, this method manages always a single instance of every action.

        This method also works with nested classes. If your action class is nested within a JavaFX controller, it may be important that the single instance of the action references members of one controller instance. In this case, provide a static getInstance()-Method that makes the controller behave like a (pseudo-)singleton.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The action type
        Parameters:
        c - The action class type
        Returns:
        The managed instance of the action class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when the action class is not accesible
        java.lang.InstantiationException - Thrown when the action class is not accesible
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Thrown when access to the getInstance method in the controller is not accessible.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - Thrown when there is no getInstance method in the controller
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - Thrown when the getInstance method cannot be invoked
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getBehaviour

        public <T extends FXAbstractBehaviour> T getBehaviour(java.lang.Class<T> c,
                                                      boolean isSingleton)
                                               throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Deprecated. Experimental - needs to be moved to the aeFXBehaviour project.
        Fetch an instance of the behaviour type, either a new one or an already created instance from the internal instance map.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Any descendant of FXAbstractBehaviour
        Parameters:
        c - The behaviour class
        isSingleton - Whether to maintain only one instance or to create instances for each node that the behaviour is to be applied to.
        Returns:
        The behaviour instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - ... if the behaviour object cannot be instaniated. This may happen if it does not have a default constructor.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - ... if other problems arise when instantiating the behaviour object.
